replies.body: Why would you include yourself in their argument. You weren't part of it but you voluntarily included yourself. I have no pity for you. Was this a permaban?

It was also only based on one game , which riot usually doesnt ban you off one game , unless it is really bad. I just want to know how that can count as to be so severe as to insta-permaban me off one game.

It wasn't one game that got you a perma-ban. It was the 10-game chat restriction, the 25-game chat restriction,  and 14-day ban in addition to this one game.

You were warned numerous times and were told with your last punishment that it was your final warning. You can of course open a ticket with player support if you feel the ban is not deserved.

I agree that arguing with trolls doesnt actually help, but I guess we have really different opinions on the whole "small offenses deserve perma bans if they happen often enough"- thing.

Hey Summoner,

Retaliation is almost never a reasonable reaction to other toxic players. The player you are retaliating against probably *wants* to see you get upset. When you get into an argument you are just creating new problems for the other players, and the trolls will just egg you on even more. The best thing to do is just mute them and report their behavior.

If you feel you have issues controlling your actions, I suggest muting them upon entering the match by typing "/mute all", or moving the chat window off the screen so you can't read it.

Punishment has 4 tiers, and are typically administered in order;

* 10 game chat restriction
* 25 game chat restriction
* 14 day account ban
* Permanent account ban

Except in extreme cases such as hate speech and death threats, you'll get them one at a time in order. It takes 3 months for your next punishment tier to drop down *one* step. http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/f/mNBeEEkI/d/p7scKW1K?comment=00050000000000000000

I suggest reading this material for more information on how you are expected to behave, and how reports work;

http://gameinfo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/get-started/summoners-code/

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/reports-how-do-they-work

If you would like to contest your punishment with Riot, you may submit a [Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new), but Riot will not remove a punishment unless it was done in error.

Let me know if you have any questions. Please be respectful if you want to be taken seriously.

-DTN

Riot usually does not ban people off one game , they have said that you will get a warning before, unless it is severe. This game seemed to count as a severe case of toxicity. I have already been banned for 14 days , and i made the effort to stop , no reports. After this game i was instantly banned when people were provoking me. How does this count as to be so bad to insta-permaban me?

If anything in a match is considered reportable, the whole match is flagged to contribute to punishment. If you just got off of a punishment that means you are on the very edge and basically any infraction will push you over again. You have to pad your record with positive games to reduce your risk of punishment. As I mentioned, the punishment after a 14 day is a perma; what pushes your case over the edge to be reviewed doesn't matter.

To me it looks like most (not all) of your chat that would've been flagged as verbal abuse was you stating things that happened to *you* rather than being directed at another player. I suggest submitting a [Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and requesting they manually review your case, and explain the parts that could've falsely been flagged as abusive.
